headlines: DJIA crosses 50k for first time as US equities surge on AI CapEx optimism
US-India trade deal framework reached with $500bn energy/tech commitment
PM Takaichi's LDP wins landslide supermajority in Japanese election

USD.summary: Dollar marginally softer in rangebound trade as DXY hovers around 97.08. Fed officials signal cautious approach with Vice Chair Jefferson noting policy is well-positioned and roughly neutral, while Daly leans toward more cuts but supported last week's hold. Key NFP and CPI data later this week will drive direction.
headlines: Fed Vice Chair Jefferson: Policy roughly in neutral stance
Fed's Daly leans toward more rate cuts in 2026 but hard to say if one or two

EUR.summary: Euro eked slight gains after returning to 1.1800 handle late last week, but further upside capped by lack of drivers from the Eurozone. ECB's Cipollone said the central bank will assess the effect of euro strength on consumer inflation in quarterly forecasts due next month. EUR/USD stuck in consolidation mode.
headlines: ECB's Cipollone: Will assess euro strength effect on inflation next month
European equity futures up 0.4% after Friday's 1.2% cash market gain

GBP.summary: Pound struggled for direction with price action stuck around 1.3600 level amid further political headwinds for UK PM Starmer's premiership. Chief of staff Morgan McSweeney resigned due to Mandelson scandal, adding to mounting pressure on the government. Cable lacks clear directional catalyst.
headlines: UK PM Starmer's chief of staff Morgan McSweeney resigns

JPY.summary: Yen swung between gains and losses following PM Takaichi's landslide election victory. LDP won supermajority (274-328 seats alone, 302-366 with coalition), allowing override of upper house. Initial USD/JPY advances erased as JGB yields climbed. Takaichi pledged to speed up sales tax cut consideration and build resilience against forex swings.
headlines: PM Takaichi's LDP wins supermajority with 274-328 seats
Takaichi to speed up sales tax cut consideration

AUD.summary: Aussie benefitted from risk-on sentiment as APAC stocks rallied following Wall Street's surge. ASX 200 rallied with broad strength in tech, real estate, miners, and materials. China's Cabinet studied measures to promote effective investment and pledged to boost support for private investment, supporting regional sentiment.
headlines: ASX 200 rallies with broad sector strength
China Cabinet pledges to boost private investment support

CAD.summary: Loonie lacked fresh catalysts with no major Canadian data releases. Price action consolidating after Friday's jobs-driven volatility. Focus on broader risk sentiment and crude oil price movements. USD/CAD rangebound as markets await key US data later this week.

CHF.summary: Franc underperformed in risk-on environment as safe-haven demand faded. S&P affirmed Denmark at 'AAA' with stable outlook, but no direct Swiss catalysts. CHF typically weakens when global equities rally and geopolitical tensions ease. No fresh SNB commentary.
headlines: S&P affirms Denmark at 'AAA'; outlook stable

NZD.summary: Kiwi outperformed as high-beta currency in risk-on trade. Benefitted from APAC equity rally and broader Dollar weakness. No fresh NZ data, but regional sentiment supported by China's investment support pledges and Japan's political stability post-election.
